551.name: {WAt the steps of {WC{ra{Ws{rt{Wl{re {WP{re{Ws{rt{Wo{rl{We{rn{Wc{ri{Wa{x
description: {8Walking through the large {ri{yr{ro{yn{8 gates, a surrounding {Bc{Ch{bi{Cl{Bl{8 of
darkness can be felt.  The large castle ahead seems almost like an
illusion.  Having the same tantalizing effect the gates had, it
absorbs all light, leaving nothing but darkness and the eerie black
that one cannot become accustomed to.  A clattering noise of flapping
wings pervades the land followed by a deafening screech that emanates
endlessly from within the castle.  It serves as a reminisce of the
horrific tales mother's told their children of while they were
children.  This can only be one thing...  Ghazneths.  {x

553.name: {8 A walkway in front of {WC{ra{Ws{rt{Wl{re{W P{re{Ws{rt{Wo{rl{We{rn{Wc{ri{Wa{x
description: {DBushes composed completely of thorns and stick surround the castle{x
{Dupon the grounds.  The walls of the castle, slick, and unscalable,{x
{Dloom over head, producing a very foreboding air.  Ravens fly over{x
{Dhead, evil and diseased; footsoldiers of pestolencia theyre humanoid{x
{Dcounterparts.  What of these bushes and seemingly deserted castle,{x
{Dthere must be something more, for such a regalia to be guarding it...{x

562.name: {WA Side Chamber
description: {8 Branching off the main walk of the inner castle, a smiple room
with tapestries hung and pictures mounted upon the walls lies.  It
appears quite barren except for a bookshelf and some random furniture.
Stones on the one of the walls are beginning to waste away, creating
holes and cracks that allow a draft to enter, as well as unwanted
creatures.  {x

570.name: {8The {bC{Bo{gm{Gm{Yan{Gd{ge{Br{bs {8Barracks{x
description: {8Probably the most hygenic of all {WP{re{Ws{rt{Wo{rl{We{rn{Wc{ri{Wa{8, the commander's
quarters features an actual bed frame with a mattress, and sheets put
up to cut down on the smell emanating from the mess hall.  In the
middle of the room, a table stands cluttered with plans and a to-scale
map of the area, figurines set upon it making one wonder if they
actually have some form of organization or if they were playing a
childish game.

561.name: {WLiving quarters{8 in the {yBarracks
description: {8Several makeshift hammocks line the wall; pads upon the floor.
This one room dorm is that of the entire {Wp{re{Ws{rt{Wo{rl{We{rn{Wc{ri{Wa{rn{8 army.  As the
saying goes, evil never sleeps.  Void of a square-inch of air
nonstagnant to the accumulated sweat and {Gt{yo{gx{ri{gc{Gi{yt{gy{8, the room can only
be described as foul.  It is understandable why this evil never
sleeps.

575.name: {WA {wCi{Wrc{8u{Wla{wr {WChamber{x
description: {DYou have entered a flat room, quite a relief from the cramped{x
{Ddankness of the sloping passage.  All around is darkness, the only{x
{Dlight a shaft from a door frame on the other side of the chamber.{x
{DNothing can be seen but the light, the scatterings and chitters{x
{Dradiating through the chamber like a tumultous ocean.{x

568.name: {8The {yBarracks{8 of {WC{ra{Ws{rt{Wl{re {WP{re{Ws{rt{Wo{rl{We{rn{Wc{ri{Wa{x
description: {DA table stretches from the entrance of the barracks to the far{x
{Dwall, centering the room.  A few soldiers eat, while others are on{x
{Dwatch, or off duty.  A ripped tapestry lines each wall, and the{x
{Doverall hygeine of the place screams disrepair.  An accurate portrayal{x
{Dof Pestolencia, and those that live and serve under its rule.{x

569.name: {WA {rCell {Wwithin the {yBarracks{x
description: {8Three walls of solid stone, and a fourth of heavy bars, this is
certainly the epitome of a sturdy and capable cell.  It seems recently
used, though the lock is completely blasted apart, rendering the cell
useless.

552.name: {8At the front door of {WC{ra{Ws{rt{Wl{re {WP{re{Ws{rt{Wo{rl{We{rn{Wc{ri{Wa{x
description: {DYou stand at the front doorway of the Castle Pestolencia.  All{x
{Daround the inhabitants of pestolencia stalk warily, waiting for their{x
{Dturn for some action.  The door ahead is wrought of wood, large and{x
{Dsturdy, but not of any worry to open for a brave adventurer.  To the{x
{Deast and west lie different paths, roaming along the perimeter of the{x
{Dcastle, heavily guarded as ever.{x

558.name: {WInside of {WC{ra{Ws{rt{Wl{re {WP{re{Ws{rt{Wo{rl{We{rn{Wi{rc{Wa{x
description: {DOn each side of the door, a statue of a robed figure seemingly{x
{Dgreets you as you walk in, an eery feeling emanating from them.  All{x
{Dthroughout the room, tapestries and banners of Pestolencia lie, though{x
{Din a state of disrepair.  Still heavily guarded throughot, it is{x
{Dentertaining to speculate as to what could be such a big deal in a run{x
{Ddown castle like this...{x

559.name: {8The {yBarracks {8of {WC{ra{Ws{rt{Wl{re {WP{re{Ws{rt{Wo{rl{We{rn{Wc{ri{Wa{x
description: {DA table stretches from the entrance of the barracks to the far{x
{Dwall, centering the room.  A few soldiers eat, while others are on{x
{Dwatch, or off duty.  A ripped tapestry lines each wall, and the{x
{Doverall hygeine of the place screams disrepair.  Upon the ground lie{x
{Dhalf eaten rations and broken dishes, mugs more then anything else, no{x
{Ddoubt from a night filled with heavy pestolencian drinking.{x

555.name: {8A {Wside{8 entrance to {WC{ra{Ws{rt{Wl{re {WP{re{Ws{rt{Wo{rl{We{rn{Wc{ri{Wa{x
description: {8Guarded obscenely by footsoldiers, this entrance seems much more
promising then the front.  A path has actually been cleared between
the bushes of {gt{Gh{yo{grn{8.  {8D{Wa{8rk clouds loom above the castle, theyre makeup
seemingly less of condensation and more of a {yt{go{bx{yi{gc{8 nature.  You
suddenly notice how nautious you feel; Is it the clouds, or simply
your second thoughts....  {x

566.name: {WThe {8D{We{ycr{We{8p{Wi{8t {YTh{yrone roo{Ym{W of {WP{re{Ws{rt{Wo{rl{We{rn{Wc{ri{Wa{x
description: {8Obviously once the center of any grandeur and splendor Castle
Pestolencia could of held, its current state is quite astonishingly
the opposite.  The only thing not completely delapidated is the throne
itself, shining eerily as if it was brought in yesterday.  Very little
light enters this room, just the faint glow of the hall behind.  The
entire room is filled with an eery c{Wh{Ci{Bl{Wl{8i{Cn{8g air; an overpowering
presence that only seems to make one wonder more about that flawless
throne.

572.name: {WDeeper into the Passageway{x
description: {8Footing is very hard to keep on this slick surface, nauseating
{gs{Gl{8im{ge{8 covering the floor as deep as two inches.  Scratching and
chirping sounds echo loader now, followed by an occasional deep roar
that verges on deafening; And with how slick the floor is you realize
its impossible to turn back.  {x

574.name: {WA Steady {wDow{Wnw{8ard {WPass{wage{x
description: {DAt the end of the staircase, this passageway unfolds.  It is quite{x
{Dslippery, making balance quite a tricky feat.  There is a downward{x
{Dslope in the passageway, and at the end, genuine light can be seen.{x
{DThe scatterings and flutterings are even more auditory then before,{x
{Dseemingly all around and neverending.{x

563.name: {WThe {yBarracks {wof {WC{ra{Ws{rt{Wl{re {WP{re{Ws{rt{Wo{rl{We{rn{Wc{ri{Wa{x
description: {DA table stretches from the entrance of the barracks to the far{x
{Dwall, centering the room.  A ripped tapestry lines each wall, and the{x
{Doverall hygenic quality of the place screams disrepair.  Upon the{x
{Dgrond lie half eaten rations and broken dishes, mugs more then{x
{Danything else, no doubt from a night filled with heay pestolencian{x
{Ddrinking.{x

567.name: {8The {yBarracks {8of {WC{ra{Ws{rt{Wl{re {WP{re{Ws{rt{Wo{rl{We{rn{Wc{ri{Wa{x
description: {DA table stretches from the entrance of the barracks to the far{x
{Dwall, centering the room.  A few soldiers eat, while others are on{x
{Dwatch, or off duty.  A ripped tapestry lines each wall, and the{x
{Doverall hygeine of the place screams disrepair.  In the center of the{x
{Dtable, a primitive looking game is set up, probably discontinued by{x
{Dtwo guards called to duty.{x

550.name: {wThe {8Gates {wof {WP{re{Ws{rt{Wo{rl{We{rn{Wc{ri{Wa
description: {8Before you stands a huge {ri{yr{ro{yn{8 gate, not painted black, but
seemingly sucking the light out of the area making it a deeper shade
of black then any.  This does not bode well for any who would dare
venture with in.  Written seemingly in magical letters, there is a
sign that reads '{WC{ra{Ws{rt{Wl{re {WP{re{Ws{rt{Wo{rl{We{rn{Wc{ri{Wa{8' The bars are covered with vines,
it seems that no living thing has entered these gates in years. The
thought of what may be, is nauseating.

557.name: A Trap of Castle Pestolencia
description: {DExpecting to see a gigantic entrance hall, dismay is delivered{x
{Dinstead of that satisfaction.  Moreso of a exit hall, this is one of{x
{Dthe castles many traps, and you walked straight into it.{x

590.name: {WT{rh{We {GG{Be{Yc{Bk{Go {WR{roo{Wm{x
description: {DThis dimly lit and slimy room, is much more uninviting then the{x
{Dpassage to it.  But what else is to expect in Pestolencia, one should{x
{Dof figured that out by now.  Coated with {Gslime{8, the room has a dank{x
{Dsmell.  Finally, the mystery of the skitterings and chirpings can be{x
{Dfound.  This room is inhabited by geckos, agile, and quick.  Their{x
{Dchirps resonate in this room, like a loudspeaker in a toilet.  Maybe{x
{Dthis mystery wasnt one anyone would of wanted to solve.{x

573.name: {WA {rS{Wta{yi{Wrcas{re {Win te Passageway{x
description: {8Hidden behind a large pile of rubble, a staircase is revealed, the
{gs{Gl{8im{ge{8 making even the staircase a little tedious on footing.  Light
glows dimly from down the stairway; the loud clatter of scratching and
whelps coupled with darting shadows along the dimly lit wall echos
menacingly, and extra loud roar beckoning your curiousity and your
fear.

554.name: {WA walkway in front of {WC{ra{Ws{rt{Wl{re {WP{re{Ws{rt{Wo{rl{We{rn{Wc{ri{Wa{x
description: {8Bushes composed completely of {gt{Gh{yo{grn{8 and stick surround the castle
grounds.  The walls of the castle, slick and unscalable, loom over
head forebodingly, only enhancing the already foreboding air.  Ravens
fly over head, evil and diseased; footsoldiers of pestolencia their
humanoid counterparts.  What could possibly be so important that it
need such a incredible regalia...  Gods arent guarded this well.

571.name: {WA {8S{We{ycr{We{8t {WSide {WPassageway
description: {DYou have inadvertantly discovered a side passage through the wall,{x
{Dthe walls are covered in a somewhat slimy substance.  The lighting, or{x
{Dlack there of, only permits view of which way to go.  Other then that,{x
{Dit is very hard to see where to step.  Small scattering echos can be{x
{Dheard throughout, a somewhat chirping sound here or there, followed by{x
{Da loud roar...{x

560.name: {8S{Yh{yr{Wi{yn{8e to {WP{re{Ws{rt{Wi{rl{We{rn{Wc{re{x
description: {DA makeshift altar of sorts is erected here, an pestolencian priest{x
{Dupon it inparting wisdom to the guards that listen, as much as they{x
{Dcan actually understand at least.  The shrine is woven of the thorned{x
{Dbushes from the surroundings of the castle, and lined with gecko{x
{Dpelts, an odd sight to be seen in this part of the world.{x

598.name: {wThe {GG{Be{Yc{Bk{Go {wBreeding Room{x
description: {DEven slimier then the room with 5 geckos, this room is harder to{x
{Dkeep your footing in then a lubricated plane of ice.  Instead of{x
{Dchirping, a bellowing whelp ackknowledges your entry.  Everywhere, the{x
{Dwalls, the floor, even the ceiling, is coated with small infant{x
{Dgeckos, clicking their tongue at you in fear, and anger.  Not that{x
{Dthey could do any harm to you of course, but it seems that their{x
{Dmother could make up for that, being shes twice the size of them all{x
{Dtogether.{x

564.name: {WEnd of the Hallway{x
description: {DHaving passed through the barracks, you find yourself in a hallway{x
{Dwith a door on either side, one bashed down to reveal a room, the left{x
{Dclosed by illustrious doors.  Guarded heavily, it would be wise to{x
{Dkeep alert at this juncture, you can never be to careful in{x
{Dpestolencia.  The carpet upon the ground is a deep black, with blood{x
{Dred designs upon it, including the crest of pestolencia.  Tapestries{x
{Dhang loosely upon the wall, attempting to spruce it up, but only{x
{Daccomplishing the opposite.{x

556.name: {8Pa{Wt{8h by a Large {rW{Win{8do{rw{x
description: {8The path veers closer to the castle walls here.  Bushes of {gt{Gh{yo{grn{8
closing in.  The path seems to dwindle, fading to nothing in front of
this large window.  Dark c{Wl{8oud{Ws{8 loom intimidatingly overhead.  Sounds
of the ravens cackling as they dash through the air only adds to the
menacing atmosphere this castle and its surroundings promote.  One
might worry that if the outside of the castle was this unbearable, one
could only loathe the wholy unpleasant thought of entering it.  The
large windows creaks open and shut slightly, emitting a large moan
whenever wind passes through it...  {x

565.name: {WA Side Hallway{x

with tapestries hung and pictures mounted upon the walls lies.  It
appears quite barren except for a bookshelf and some random furniture.
Stones on the one of the walls are beginning to waste away, creating
holes and cracks that allow a draft to enter, as well as unwanted
creatures.  {x

{8A malevolent force stands in front of you, radiating around a
draining aura, seemingly weakening the very existence around it to in
effort to strengthen itself.  The figure barely recognizable, takes a
humanoid form, mostly denoted from the evil shape of a grin and the
endless tunnels one can only assume are its eyes.  
 
{W"{wIf something can go wrong, it will. If it can't, it already has{W"

guarding its eggs.  Emitting chirps that rumble the walls and make
ears bleed, it dwarfs out any gecko ever beheld before.  30 feet long
and quicker then any of its predecessors, it would be a imposing foe
and a feat of bravery to overcome.

crazed eyes display his lack of sanity, but the wrinkles upon his face

{8This shadow of a former man seems to have lost all traces of a
soul.  His eyes show no life, only hatred and angst.  He screams
orders loudly to his minions with no feeling left behind the words he
speaks.  It is hard to believe a thing such as this could exist with
such the obvious lack of soul it possesses.

calculating and precise.  They readily guard pestolencia, as a home,
and for a chance of blood.  {x

{8All the inhabitants of pestilencia try to stay clear of this man,
obviously weary of him.  He stands half a man taller then any you have

description:
{WA highly crazed man stands here babbling to himself, glacing around
him at things that dont seem to be there, he is obviously barely able
to acknowledge your presence, you almost feel a estranged pity for
this creature before you realize he is just as tainted and soulless as
the rest of the inhabitants.  His head suddenly snaps to look at your
eyes and he begins to step slowly toward you, a grin spreading across
his face with every step.  {x
